title: Scratch-Geogebra Instructional Design for Integrating Computational Thinking and Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Basic programming concepts and high school-level mathematics knowledge
context.additional_context: Emphasis on collaborative problem-solving activities using Scratch and GeoGebra in BYOD environments, developing interdisciplinary thinking through a linguistics-mathematics integrated approach

learning_goals: Learners can solve mathematical problems (e.g., sequences, geometry) by designing Scratch block-based algorithms.
Visualization materials created with GeoGebra can be integrated with Scratch projects to explain the process of applying concepts
Assess mathematical modeling skills utilizing computational thinking elements (decomposition, pattern recognition, abstraction, algorithmization)
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
